intro: Manettia orbifera, commonly known as the orbifera mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, orb-shaped leaves and showy, pink or white flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant in humid forests, thriving in shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
